cyclone.name: OPHELIA
cyclone.category: Potential Tropical Cyclone (35 mph – below TS strength)
cyclone.current_location: about 370 miles SE of Charleston, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Moving generally north-northwest, forecast to come ashore along the central-north North Carolina coast Friday night/Saturday, then track inland through the Mid-Atlantic and near the New Jersey coast before moving back offshore toward southern New England late Sunday–Monday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central to northern coast of North Carolina (near Cape Lookout–Cape Fear area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge Watch from Surf City, NC to Chincoteague, VA and the Chesapeake Bay south of Smith Point
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Cape Fear, NC to Fenwick Island, DE, including Albemarle & Pamlico Sounds and Chesapeake Bay south of Smith Point
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeast and Mid-Atlantic coast from South Carolina through New Jersey
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Possible (upper bound of forecast range 2-4 in, localized 6 in)
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Unlikely (guidance shows ≤1-3 ft south of NJ, none indicated for NY/NJ harbor)
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤10%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; breezy conditions with gusts 25–35 mph most likely Saturday night–Sunday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation possible (1–2 ft) with high surf and rip currents along NJ barrier islands; less inside the harbor
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rain Friday night through Sunday with pockets of urban/poor-drainage flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents, possible minor coastal flooding at times of high tide, and reduced visibility/ceiling impacting vessel movements and cargo handling
